Title: Energy-Latency Aware Intelligent Reflecting Surface Aided Multi-Cell Mobile Edge Computing
Abstract: the explosive development of the internet of things  iot  has led to increased interest in mobile edge computing  mec  which provides computational resources at network edges to accommodate computation intensive and latency sensitive applications. intelligent reflecting surfaces  irss  have gained attention as a solution to overcome blockage problems during the offloading uplink transmission in mec systems. this paper explores irs aided multi cell networks that enable servers to serve neighboring cells and cooperate to handle resource exhaustion. we aim to minimize the joint energy and latency cost by jointly optimizing the computation tasks edge computing resources user beamforming and irs phase shifts. the problem is decomposed into two subproblems‚äîthe mec subproblem and the irs communication subproblem‚äîusing the block coordinate descent  bcd  technique. the mec subproblem is reformulated as a nonconvex quadratic constrained problem  qcp  while the irs communication subproblem is transformed into a weight sum rate problem with auxiliary variables. we propose an efficient algorithm to alternately optimize the mec resources and irs communication variables. numerical results show that our algorithm outperforms benchmarks and that multi cell mec systems achieve additional performance gains when supported by irs.
